docs.snippet: Mr. Dear lived in a white trailer on a patch of land by the Rocky Mountains and was described as “a mountain culture person.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Dear lived in a white trailer on a patch of land by the Rocky Mountains and was described as “a mountain culture person.”
docs.abstract: Investigation into Robert L Dear Jr, suspect who carried out shooting at Colorado Springs Planned Parenthood clinic, reveals itinerant loner with history of conflicts with law, neighbors and family; some acquaintances describe episodes of violence by Dear or feeling fearful of him.

headline.main: Robert Dear, Suspect in Colorado Killings, ‘Preferred to Be Left Alone’

byline.contributor: Julie Turkewitz reported from Hartsel, Richard Fausset from Goose Creek, S.C., Alan Blinder from Black Mountain, N.C., and Benjamin Mueller from New York. Jack Healy, Dave Philipps and Kassondra Cloos contributed reporting from Colorado Springs; Michael S. Schmidt from Washington; and Ashley Southall, Liam Stack, Mike McIntire and Jack Begg from New York.
byline.original: By JULIE TURKEWITZ, RICHARD FAUSSET, ALAN BLINDER and BENJAMIN MUELLER

docs.snippet: David Roberts and his wife, Elaine Kuok, couldn’t decide where to live in New York. So they decided to move to a different neighborhood every month for a year....
docs.lead_paragraph: David Roberts and his wife, Elaine Kuok, couldn’t decide where to live in New York. So they decided to move to a different neighborhood every month for a year.
docs.abstract: David Roberts and his wife Elaine Kuok, considering move to New York, spend year auditioning prospective neighborhoods, learning about the city and testing viability of home-free living in sharing economy through series of short-term Airbnb rentals.

docs.snippet: The pale, zombie-like addicts staggering through concrete underpasses make an unlikely scene in wealthy Norway's picturesque second city. As a gateway to the fjords which zigzag the oil-rich nation's long coastline, Bergen is the last stop on a gl...
docs.lead_paragraph: The pale, zombie-like addicts staggering through concrete underpasses make an unlikely scene in wealthy Norway's picturesque second city. As a gateway to the fjords which zigzag the oil-rich nation's long coastline, Bergen is the last stop on a global drug route that gives it one of the worst heroin problems in Europe.

headline.main: Norway Mulls Using Heroin to Prevent Deadly Overdoses
headline.print_headline: Norway Mulls Using Heroin to Prevent Deadly Overdoses

docs.snippet: Five new memoirs about escaping North Korea....
docs.lead_paragraph: Five new memoirs about escaping North Korea.
docs.abstract: Louisa Lim reviews books A Thousand Miles to Freedom: My Escape from North Korea by Eunsun Kim with Sebastien Falletti, In Order to Live: A North Korean Girl's Journey to Freedom by Yeonmi Park with Maryanne Vollers, The Girl With Seven Masks: A North Korean Defector’s Story by Hyeonseo Lee with David John, Stars Between the Sun and Moon: One Woman’s Life in North Korea and Escape to Freedom by Lucia Jang and Susan McClelland and Under the Same Sky: From Starvation in North Korea to Salvation in America by Joseph Kim with Stephan Talty.

docs.snippet: The ethicist weighs in on a wealthy family’s request for help with tuition, a parent’s proud oversharing, a conflicted manicure enthusiast and more....
docs.lead_paragraph: The ethicist weighs in on a wealthy family’s request for help with tuition, a parent’s proud oversharing, a conflicted manicure enthusiast and more.
docs.abstract: Kwame Anthony Appiah The Ethicist column answers questions about college financial aid for the wealthy, freelance work and whether to boycott nail salons based on industry's treatment of workers.

headline.main: Should My Rich Friends Apply for Financial Aid?
headline.print_headline: Should My Rich Friends Apply for Financial Aid?

docs.snippet: Internet trolls have learned to exploit our over-militarized police. It's a crime that's hard to stop — and hard to prosecute....
docs.lead_paragraph: Internet trolls have learned to exploit our over-militarized police. It's a crime that's hard to stop — and hard to prosecute.
docs.abstract: Disturbing trend of cyberharassment has arisen in which anonymous Internet users call in false alarms and send SWAT teams to homes of unsuspecting victims; dark and dangerous form of amusement has leveraged overmilitarized police forces in number of American communities.
